title: Monospace Sans (Phaidon Book)
content:
can anyone tell me what this font is? It looks like a monospace sans but then the “i” has kinda got serifs.

thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080930073148im_/http:/typophile.com/files/51Zr8bv4MDL_5119._SS500_.jpg)

 [‹ whats this font ?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080930073148/http:/typophile.com/node/49420 "Go to previous forum topic") [ID simple serif? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080930073148/http:/typophile.com/node/49382 "Go to next forum topic")
author: sven s

comments.content:
Sven, most Monospace sans have a serif on the i and l, it adds width to make it monospace.  
I dont’ know though what font has this u/c C with this l/c g.  
Good luck!
I hate when I put in a link in and someone takes my place… haha!
Not to worry - you seem to have had the answer, so there.

hah, this book’s even on the lineto website as a “fonts in use” example.  
thanks for the help.
It was actually designed for the book!
